pulltitle: fix autoless dying on too-new a version of less
pullsbody:
fixes https://github.com/mozilla/id.webmaker.org/issues/413

`autoless` needs less version 1.7.5 of `less`, but something else installs a `less` version 2.4.0, and `autoless` seems to not use its "own" version of `less` but simply that top level too-modern version from the top level node_modules dir. Thus, everything breaks.

This PR adds an explicit requirement for `less` 1.7.5, causing whatever needs 2.4.0 to install that locally, so that `autoless` no longer breaks all the things.

That said, ditching `autoless` and just using normal watching is probably a far more permanent solution.

fix autoless dying on too-new a version of less

autoless needs less version 1.7.5, but something else installs a 2.4.0, and autoless seems to not use its "own" version of less but simply whatever is at the top level in node_modules. Thus, breaking everything. This explicit requirement for less 1.7.5 causes whatever needs 2.4.0 to install that locally to itself, instead, so that autoless no longer breaks all the things.

That said, ditching autoless and just using normal watching is probably a far more permanent solution.

pulltitle: Add user DB to ID server
pullsbody:
This is quite a large patch, but necessarily so. It brings the user, password, and password reset code storage over from login.wmo.

In order to maintain user ids from the older system, the user tables' sequence table starts at 1,000,000. We can then import users from a login db and then we can add foreign key relations, and new users ids won't have collisions with old ones.

migration flow is:
1. run `psql -d <oauthDB> -f migrations/1_add_user_tables.sql`
2. run `node scripts/migrate_legacy_webmaker_users.js`
3. run `psql -d <oauthDB> -f migrations/2_add_user_fk.sql`

Here's an overview of the changes:
- Rewrote all the queries in Knex
- Refactored the OAuthDB module to use the knex code, made the code simpler and easier to read.
- I moved all the crypto related functions into a separate module

Things to note:
- I had to create a custom jshintrc so that jshint stopped bugging me about ES6 features. I should probably open up an upstream issue to add support for stable ES6 features (arrow notation, block scoped variables, object property shorthand, etc).
-  I still have to write some tests, and do an audit of the stuff I've written, to make sure this patch is at pairity with when it connected to the wmlogin server.

migration flow is:
1. run `psql -d <oauthDB> -f migrations/1_add_user_tables.sql`
2. run `node scripts/migrate_legacy_webmaker_users.js`
3. run `psql -d <oauthDB> -f migrations/2_add_user_fk.sql`

Here's an overview of the changes:
- Rewrote all the queries in Knex
- Refactored the OAuthDB module to use the knex code, made the code simpler and easier to read.
- I moved all the crypto related functions into a separate module

Things to note:
- I had to create a custom jshintrc so that jshint stopped bugging me about ES6 features. I should probably open up an upstream issue to add support for stable ES6 features (arrow notation, block scoped variables, object property shorthand, etc).
-  I still have to write some tests, and do an audit of the stuff I've written, to make sure this patch is at pairity with when it connected to the wmlogin server.

pullsbody:
See issue #318 and https://github.com/mozilla/api.webmaker.org/issues/178, using zxcvbn to add a password meter instead of specific character requirements. Anything with a score < 2/4 will be blocked from signing up.

I haven't been able to test actually creating a new account with this, and it can be a little bit buggy (especially if you click the Password field then click away then enter a password, it doesn't recognize that a password has been entered until you click away [though I think it's always been like that?])
